CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 9, 1965, pg. 15, reads: "LIVINGSTONE POW-WOW - Dr. Samuel E. Duncan (right), president of Livingstone College, Salisbury, N.C., who was one of the featured speakers for the recent 112th Pennsylvania State Teachers Convention, at the Pittsburgh Hilton and Penn-Sheraton Hotels, was honored during a reception, sponsored by Livingstone alumni, at the Wesley Center AME Zion Church, in Pittsburgh.  Miss E. Marie Coleman (seated), whose identity with the school dates back for nearly half a century, holds the point of interest in this pow-wow.  The Rev. Arthaniel Harris (second for the left) is president of the Livingstone Alumni Association.  Dr. Charles H. Foggie (second from right), host pastor, shares the intrigue of the others in picture, including Miss Sarah McKee (left), a senior at Livingstone and Douglas Johnson (back center) a freshman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Sarah McKee, Rev. Arthaniel Harris, Douglas Johnson, Rev. Charles H. Foggie, and Livingstone College president Dr. Samuel E. Duncan, surrounding E. Marie Coleman seated in center, in Wesley Center AME Zion lounge for Livingstone College Alumni Association reception
